channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-7770] ViewFS getFileChecksum throws FileNotFoundException for files in /tmp and /user
item.description:
Thanks to Rohini Palaniswamy for discovering this bug. To quote

When doing getFileChecksum for path /user/hadoopqa/somefile, it is trying to fetch checksum for /user/user/hadoopqa/somefile. If /tmp/file, it is trying /tmp/tmp/file. Works fine for other FS operations.
item.summary: ViewFS getFileChecksum throws FileNotFoundException for files in /tmp and /user

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Attaching a unit test which fails due to the issue.
Now I'll try to fix this issue.

Seems like we forgot to change f to res.remainingPath only for getFileChecksum.

Including this patch. Can someone please review and commit?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12500880/HADOOP-7770.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/318//console

This message is automatically generated.
Patch failed last time because the test was in HDFS code. Including a test now which is in common.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12500892/HADOOP-7770.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 javac. The applied patch generated 1037 javac compiler warnings (more than the trunk's current 1036 warnings).

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed the unit tests build

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/320//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/320//artifact/trunk/hadoop-common-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/320//console

This message is automatically generated.

Added suppress warnings for the javac warnings -1.
The findbugs warning is not related to this patch.
The core tests did not fail. (From what I can tell from the consoleOutput, the maven build failed on some .war file issue). Not related to this patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12500934/HADOOP-7770.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed the unit tests build

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/322//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/322//artifact/trunk/hadoop-common-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/322//console

This message is automatically generated.
Suresh! The findbugs warning is spurious. And the precommit build is broken for everyone (https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/) Could you please review and commit the last patch?

Oops! I didn't notice earlier.
I think the similar problem exists in ViewFS also. Can you please fix that along with this patch?
Thanks Jitendra! I completely missed that. I'm attaching a patch which makes the change in both the places along with unit tests. Could you please review it?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12501191/HADOOP-7770.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/337//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/337//artifact/trunk/hadoop-common-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/337//console

This message is automatically generated.
Committed. Thanks to Ravi Prakash!
